result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian D Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work.  Good time allowed.

miscConds.notes: $4,250.00 to Cagney and Regina S.  To be paid first, before all other costs and surcharges.
Seek and maintain employment. Job and vocational training.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms or body armor; and his voting rights are restricted unti they are restored.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Cagney or Regina S. or their residence.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Anger management counseling.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

Pay all costs, surcharges,  DNA surcahrge, costs, disbursements and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  Failure to pay amounts would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

timeConds.notes: STAYED: to be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.  No huber or good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian D Watson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Civil Judgment in the amount of $4250.00 for unpaid restitution.

Defendant Adrian D Watson in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation agent Amy Schmitt in court.  Defendant has discharged from probation effective 5-20-2016 and is not agreeing to an extension.  Probation department failed to bring matter back to court in timely manner for court to order extension of probation for purposes of court ordered oblilgations.  The defendant states that he is willing to pay restitution once he is able.  The court directs that a civil judgment be entered for restitution in the amount of $4250.00 payable to Cagney and Regina S.  Order signed by the court.
Probation Agent is requesting a hearing as to extension of probation.  Case set for 5-24-2016 at 8:15.  Agent to advise defendant of date and time.

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[ X ]   Extension, Unpaid Obligations
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
A hearing will have to be scheduled     [ X ] YES     [   ]  NO
Agent will appear                                    [ X ]  YES    [   ]  NO

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adrian D Watson in court with attorney Rosemary R Cuevas.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  Branch 20 in trial with a jury question and it is close to noon; Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail are to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrian D Watson in court with attorney Rosemary R Cuevas.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions, Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court ordered the defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms or body armour, and his voting rights are restricted until they are restored. Court ordered bial condtions continued.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrian D Watson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  James C. Griffin appeared on behalf of Tyrone St. Junior, II for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel's request for a short adjournment was granted by the Court.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail are to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrian D Watson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted same and ordered all terms and conditions of bail remain.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrian D Watson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Tyrone St. Junior.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested an adjournment to obtain an offer from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Adrian D Watson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Paul Hauer for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAGNEY & REGINA S. OR THEIR RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Adrian D Watson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Adrian D Watson in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
